text:
I'm using JULIA 1.5.2 and try to do some simple plots using Makie,jl. In the documantation I found the following lines of code:
*using* CairoMakie
scene, layout = layoutscene(resolution = (1200, 900))
ax = layout[1, 1] = Axis(scene, xlabel = "x label", ylabel = "y label",
    title = "Title")
lineobject = lines!(ax, 0..10, sin, color = :red)

and I allways get the error message: layoutscene is undefined
What is the problem?

elements.text: I'm using JULIA 1.5.2 and try to do some simple plots using Makie,jl. In the documantation I found the following lines of code:

CairoMakie
scene, layout = layoutscene(resolution = (1200, 900))
ax = layout[1, 1] = Axis(scene, xlabel = "x label", ylabel = "y label",
    title = "Title")
lineobject = lines!(ax, 0..10, sin, color = :red)

and I allways get the error message: layoutscene is undefined
What is the problem?

text:
There has been a change in the Makie ecosystem to use
`    fig = Figure(resolution= (1200,900))` instead of layoutscene in the newest version and some parts of the docs are not updated yet.

elements.text:
There has been a change in the Makie ecosystem to use
`    fig = Figure(resolution= (1200,900))` instead of layoutscene in the newest version and some parts of the docs are not updated yet.

text: Thank you, but even when I change it to Figure() I get the same error: UndefVarError: Figure not defined.

elements.text: Thank you, but even when I change it to Figure() I get the same error: UndefVarError: Figure not defined.

text: I'm working with Julia 1.5.2 and CairoMakie v0.3.14

elements.text: I'm working with Julia 1.5.2 and CairoMakie v0.3.14

text: I can't reproduce this with CairoMakie 0.3.14. Do you have other packages loaded which would also define Figure?

elements.text: I can't reproduce this with CairoMakie 0.3.14. Do you have other packages loaded which would also define Figure?
